      • addProperties

        public void addProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
        Adds custom properties to the user. This info is used to provide more context around who a user is.

        Values must be of type String, Integer, Long, Float, Double, or Date; any other type will be converted to String using the toString() method.

        Changes to user properties are uploaded in batches at regular intervals, when the app is sent to the background, or when a message is sent. This API is additive, and subsequent calls will override values for the provided keys.

        Parameters:
        properties - Map of properties

      • getUserId

        public java.lang.String getUserId()
        String representing the user's userId. This property is set by calling Sempro.login(String, String, SemproCallback).

        Unlike appUserId, this value is assigned and managed by the developer, and is used to identify a user across devices and app installations.

        Returns:
        The user's userId

      • getAppUserId

        public java.lang.String getAppUserId()
        The assigned appUserId for this user.

        Unlike getUserId(), this property is set automatically by Sempro, and is not configurable. This is analogous to appUser._id in the REST API response. A user is assigned an appUserId once they start a conversation or when an existing user is logged in by calling Sempro.login(String, String, SemproCallback).

        Returns:
        The user's appUserId

      • hasPaymentInfo

        public boolean hasPaymentInfo()
        Boolean describing whether or not the user has payment information stored
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating whether or not the User has payment info stored
